{"step_by_step_thinking": "Histamine is a chemical mediator that is released during an allergic reaction or inflammation. It is primarily stored in mast cells and basophils. Lymphocytes are a type of white blood cell that play a role in the immune response, but they do not contain histamine. Neutrophils are another type of white blood cell that are involved in the immune response, but they do not contain histamine either. Erythrocytes, also known as red blood cells, do not contain histamine. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Mast cells.", "answer_choice": "B"}
